intro: Gonolobus petiolaris, commonly known as the long-petioled morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves with long petioles. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other well-known morning glory species. Gonolobus petiolaris is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
